meanings.definition: In a specified state or condition, typically as a result of previous training or circumstances.
meanings.sent1: After the storm, the garden was well-conditioned with fresh soil.
meanings.sent2: She always arrives early, so she is well-conditioned to be on time.
meanings.sent3: The cat was surprisingly conditioned to enjoy baths.
meanings.sent4: His mind was conditioned to think positively in any situation.
meanings.sent5: The athlete's body was perfectly conditioned for the upcoming race.

meanings.definition: To train or accustom (someone or something) to behave in a certain way or to accept certain circumstances.
meanings.sent1: The coach conditioned the team to work together seamlessly.
meanings.sent2: He conditioned his dog to sit before receiving a treat.
meanings.sent3: She conditioned her plants to grow in a unique pattern.
meanings.sent4: The teacher conditioned the students to raise their hands before speaking.
meanings.sent5: The scientist conditioned the rats to press a lever for food rewards.
